Node.definition: = exclamation expressing emotion concerning suffering that will come over an individual or nation

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= referent to a male participant that is addressed in a discourse

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

Node.gloss: to ravage|to devastate|to lay waster|to plunder
Node.definition: = action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds

Node.gloss: to act unfaithfully|to be treacherous|to deal treacherously|to break faith|to betray
Node.definition: = pattern of behavior by which humans act in a way which shows a lack of truthfulness and commitment, both in words and deeds
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

Node.gloss: to be kindly disposed|to be generous|to be merciful|to be gracious|to pity
Node.definition: = state in which humans or deities are favorably disposed to (other) humans, and act accordingly

Node.gloss: to look for|to wait for|to hope for
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience a desire for something to happen, together with a degree of confidence that this desire will be fulfilled through the intervention of someone else; as a result, they are willing to defer taking action for some time
literally: arm; hence: = the ability to exert strength
= first half of the day, ranging from daybreak until noon; ≈ used figuratively to denote relief after a time of suffering, and associated with good as opposed to evil

marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied), and also often used to affirm this new information as more conclusive or compelling than the information preceding it
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= a process by which humans go through extremely difficult circumstances, resulting in severe anxiety, ◄ as if one were confined to a narrow and cramped space from which there is no escape
= action by which humans, animals, or objects produce a variety of sounds, sometimes associated with natural phenomena like heavy rain and the waves of a stormy sea
= action by which humans or animals move away in haste from a certain place ► in order to escape from a situation that is considered dangerous

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
= to bring together people, animals, plants, and/or other things from different places for a common purpose
= act of bringing in crops from the field at the time of harvest
exact meaning unkown; probably: = juvenile form of locust (אַרְבֶּה)
= process by which animals move forward at great speed and with aggressive intent

= six legged, winged insect that is characterized by the fact that its third pair of legs is elongated and adapted to hopping; insects of this type move in swarms at certain periods and migrate to new areas, which they colonize; at other times they live either solitary or in small groups; ◄ Acrididae family; ► normally eaten cooked by toasting, grilling, frying, or broiling, though in some places they are also eaten raw; clean animal, that may be eaten; ≈ associated with destruction
= process by which animals move forward at great speed and with aggressive intent
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to fill (with an activity); hence: = causative action in which deities cause humans to be fully engaged in a certain activity, either as victim or as active participant
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= practices that conform to the laws of God

= pattern of behavior of humans or deities that is in accordance to the requirements of the divine law and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this pattern as a standard, which in certain cases requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness
= state in which the circumstances of life do not change in any significant way; ≈ associated with security and well being
= a shorter or longer moment in the passage of time
= objects that are considered valuable to have
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the rescue or protection (of humans in need) implying success
= state in which humans, deities or animals have a certain level of wisdom, intelligence, or proficiency
literally: knowing; hence: = a collection of information stored and processed in someone's mind that gives that person the ability to analyse, discern, make decisions and act accordingly
= state in which humans experience fear
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= referent to a female person or another object that is considered feminine
= valuable goods in one's possession; ≈ falsely considered a source of well being
= soldier known for his extreme bravery, strength, and/or ability to fight; ◄ compared to a lion
= referent to the location outside of an object
= a human or supernatural being who carries a message on behalf of someone else
= state in which condition or action is motivated or accompanied by deep distress

Node.gloss: to cry|to weep|to lament|to mourn|to bewail
Node.definition: = action by which someone express his/her grief or sorrow by shedding tears, crying loud and making appropriate gestures, ◄ because of some personal or national calamity, or for a dead person
= a relatively wide road or access ramp made by by covering the surface of the ground with thicks layers of sand
= relatively narrow road (דֶּרֶךְ) that connects two locations and facilitates travelling
= a solemn agreement between two or more parties (persons, groups, nations, deities) with stipulations, blessings, and curses
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security

Node.gloss: to think of|to have regard for
Node.definition: = state/process by which humans or deities consider something or someone valuable or of interest
= human being; ◄ created by God; ≈ often associated with weakness, fragility, and mortality

= process by which plants and their products become devoid of moisture, and therefore lose color and bend over ◄ as if in mourning, ► which may ultimately result in death if circumstances do not change; ≈ associated with drought and destruction, often as punishment from God

= state of being unable to function as can be expected; ◄ as a result of destruction, a drought, or God's direct intervention; ► results include weakness, sadness, shame, death, and disintegration, depending on the situation

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= process by which humans experience a strong emotion of shame
= range of mountains; ◄ north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) ► known for the cedar (אֶרֶז) and other trees growing there
= process by which plants dry up and die ◄ for lack of water; usually associated with grief, hardship, and punishment from God
= plain; ◄ along the coast of the Mediterranean
= region; ◄ north east of the River Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) ► at one time ruled by king Og (עֹוג) later assigned to half of the tribe of Manasseh (מְנַשֶּׁה)
= mountain; ◄ located in north of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) overlooking the Mediterranean Sea
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= action by which deities prepare themselves to intervene, ◄ as if rising from a sitting position
= a marker indicating that an important statement is following and demanding the attention of the listener
= process by which someone becomes pregnant

meaning unsure; either: (1) = dried grass or leaves; ► useless, ≈ and considered of little value; or: (2) = the husks of grain or other seed, separated by winnowing or threshing; ► useless, ≈ and considered of little value
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

= dry grass like remnant of wheat or another grain crop following the harvest; this term possibly refers to two kinds of material, one being the remnant of the crop remaining in the ground, the other being the unwanted residue of stalks; ► only used for brick making; ≈ usually considered of little value and needing to be separated from the grain itself; maybe burned

= the air that is taken in and expelled through the lungs by humans and animals, which makes them live, and which distinguishes them from inanimate objects like idols; ≈ regarded as coming from God; sometimes God is depicted as a breathing being as well

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten
= substance produced by burning limestone or other materials containing calcium; ► mixed with water to produce whitewash
= small shrub with thorns; ≈ associated with things of no value, aggression, and destruction
= causative action by which humans remove a relatively large plant or tree from its trunk with a sharp tool

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.

Node.gloss: to set fire on|to set on fire
Node.definition: = action by which someone causes something to start burning, usually with effects on people and nature around; ≈ associated with punishment and judgement
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action
= process by which humans or deities acquire information about other humans, deities, or certain facts, which is stored in the mind
= events that require the ability to accomplish great things through characteristics such as physical strength, power, bravery, skill, wealth, good character, or a combination thereof
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place
= pattern of actions by which humans commit specified or implied offenses, ► resulting in a state of guilt which may require atonement, restitution, and retribution

Node.gloss: to grasp|to take hold of (something)|to seize|to catch|to hold on (to something)
Node.definition: = to take hold of someone or something; humans typically do this with their hands and animals use their mouths; however, it is often extended to include inanimate objects (traps), personalized qualities (wisdom), emotions (anger, fear), or processes (time)
= process by which the human body shakes, ◄ as a result of fear
= state in which humans are impure in character, without regard or respect for God

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time

= state of burning, in which substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and give out bright light, heat, and smoke; ► used for cooking, melting, cleansing, heating, and destroying; ≈ many aspects of life are compared with fire, such as anger, jealousy, aggression, wickedness, words, life, certain sicknesses, suffering, etc.
= action by which people or objects are removed from existence in a violent way ◄ as food that is eaten

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to sojourn|to live as alien|to dwell
Node.definition: = state in which humans live in a place which is not their place of origin or nationality, either permanently or for a substantial period of time
= fire; ≈ associated with God's punishment, which is too heavy for humans to bear
= a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, whether in the past or in the future
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life

= action of humans or deities that is in accordance with the requirements of the divine law and and generally aimed at establishing or restoring this type of behavior as a standard, which often requires a victory over evil and results in prosperity and happiness

= action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually not directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
literally: smoothness; hence: = state in which an event is morally and ethically right
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
= possessions accumulated through advantageous transactions, in which part of the income can be kept for oneself, mostly achieved in an unjust way

Node.gloss: to make a sign of refusal|to refuse
Node.definition: = to move one's hands in a way that indicates one's unwillingness to accept something that is offered
= an object, usually of some value, given to a person; ► can be given without any expectation of exchange or often with the purpose to influence or persuade another person
= to cover part of the body so that it cannot perform some function
= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used for hearing; also a common place to wear jewelry
= causative action by which humans kill other humans in a violent way, usually involving the shedding of blood, which brings guilt upon the people committing these acts
literally: to close the eyes (from doing something); hence: = action by which humans deliberately and purposefully refrain from engaging in a particlar activity

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

= area shaped and located in such a way that it is hard to access and can be easily defended against enemies; ◄ this can be a natural stronghold in the mountains (e.g. caves) or a construction erected by humans in populated areas; ≈ often associated with security and sometimes used as an epithet for leaders or deities that are considered providers of security
= a high and therefore unattainable location, either because of its natural environment or as a result of human construction efforts, ≈ associated with security and protection from the enemy
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= state in which an event is likely to last for a long time, ≈ which can be either good or bad
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= state in which the outward appearance of humans or objects is pleasing to the eye
= process by which someone perceives an important object with the eyes, or witnesses an event of some significance

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= action by which humans utter words with the focus on what is said
= state of strong fear because of an actual or perceived danger, such as aggression from the enemy, a dangerous animal, or death
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons or objects
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= a reference to an unknown location, but focused on the question whether an object actually exists at all, rather than with a specific location in mind
= action with which one determines or estimates the number of a collection of persons or objects

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= relatively high structure made of stone; ► used for guarding the surrounding area and/or for providing protection against hostile forces from outside; ≈ associated with security and protection

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix

Node.gloss: to be arrogant|to be proud|to be insolent
Node.definition: meaning unsure; possibly: = state in which humans are overly confident
literally: deep of tongue; hence: = state in which people speak a language that others find hard to understand
literally: a mocking tongue; hence: = action by which humans speak a foreign language that is unintelligible and sounds as if they are mocking
literally: tongue; hence: = a system of communication used by a community, ethnic group, or nation

Node.gloss: there is not|it is not|it does not
Node.definition: = state in which an object or event is either absent or non existant
= state whereby someone has the ability to see through the outward appearance of things and grasp their essence

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans focus their eyes on someone or something in order to see it well
= mountain; ► that part of Jerusalem (יְרוּשָׁלַ͏ִם) on which the temple was built, also known as a fortress and stronghold, city of David (דָּוִד) YHWH's dwelling place

= relatively large and permanent population center, usually surrounded by a wall and surrounded by a number of dependent villages (חָצֵר) settlements (בַּת) and pasturelands (מִגְרָשׁ) ≈ associated with strength and security
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times

= one of two parts of the body of humans and animals that is used to see things, after which the observed information is stored and processed in the mind; sparkling when the body is healthy and strong, but dim when weak or sick; the eyes also play a significant role in determining whether a person is considered beautiful or not; eyes can reflect both an attitude of compassion and a sentiment of malice; ≈ high eyes are associated with pride, whereas lowly eyes are connected with humility; a good eye is associated with generosity, whereas an evil eye denotes stinginess; winking the eye is associated with underhanded practices

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= town, formerly referred to as Salem (שָׁלֵם) and Jebus (יְבוּס) located on Mt. Zion (צִיֹּון) territory of Judah (יְהוּדָה) ► conquered by king David (דָּוִד) who made it the capital of his kingdom
= state in which humans live a peaceful life and have nothing to fear, which can easily lead to carelessness and arrogance
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which an object is moved from one place to another
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to pull out|to pull up|to uproot|to quarry
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans remove an object from another object into which it had been inserted or attached in a different way
= small, pointed object ► driven into a wall or the ground and used for hanging things on or securing something in place; ≈ associated with firmness and security
poetic term: = a long duration of time that is or may seem unending, usually in the future

= piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibres, linen, or reeds; ► used for tying and keeping things together, climbing, measuring, drawing things to oneself, making traps, etc.; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to conditions that try to take control of people; a rope tied around the head is a symbol of submission
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= set of particles marking an object or event as opposed to other objects and events
= pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
(YHWH will provide what the people of Zion need, like) rivers (provide for the well being of those who live near them)
= a stream of flowing water in a general sense; ≈ symbolizing an abundance of water and the fertility it brings, resulting in further blessings
literally: wide of hands; hence: = state in which a certain object has a relatively large distance from side to side
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= process by which liquids or other inanimate objects move from one place to another
literally: ship of oars; hence: = relatively large ship, propelled by sails and oars
= boat of a relatively large size; ► able to sail the sea and ocean
= pertaining to inspiring awe and respect ◄ because of one's beauty, size, strength, or status
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: one who decrees; hence: = person who is in a position of authority over other people
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= supreme secular and male ruler of a nation or people; ≈ associated with authority, power, honor, but also with justice; also used as a reference to one's deity
= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine
= causative action by which humans or deities come to the help of humans in need, whether in military, civil or judicial contexts

= piece of stout cord; ◄ made by twisting together palm fibres, linen, or reeds; ► used for tying and keeping things together, climbing, measuring, drawing things to oneself, making traps, etc.; ≈ often used in a figurative sense to refer to conditions that try to take control of people; a rope tied around the head is a symbol of submission
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative action by which humans ensure that an object cannot be moved from its place
= long wooden pole; ◄ part of a ship; ► functions as support of sail(s)
= particle marking a proposition as not true
= causative action by which humans spread out an object, such as a piece of cloth, a net, or a document either horizontally or vertically
= large sheet of fabric attached above a boat ► to catch the wind and thus move the boat forward through the water
= referent pointing to a specific point in time, either in the past or the future
= action by which humans divide an object (or range of objects) into portions and share them out among each other
= valuable goods or objects taken forcibly from a person or group, usually from an enemy or invader
= action by which someone takes all sorts of goods (including people and animals) by force from an enemy in war
= all sorts of goods, taken forcibly from an enemy in war
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

Node.gloss: to be, become weak|to be, become powerless|to be sick|to be injured
Node.definition: = process by which humans lose their physical strength ◄ as a result of sickness, injury, a prolonged exertion of strength, or other circumstances
= process by which humans make a certain place or area their home
literally: to bear; hence: = action by which humans or deities let go of any anger or resentment with regard to the wrongdoing or sin of (other) humans
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
